metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5733 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A malicious client which is allowed to send very large amounts of traffic (billions of packets) to a DHCP server can eventually overflow a 32-bit reference counter, potentially causing dhcpd to crash. Affects ISC DHCP 4.1.0 -> 4.1-ESV-R15, 4.2.0 -> 4.2.8, 4.3.0 -> 4.3.6, 4.4.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

isc-dhcp-client - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-client-ddns - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-common - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-relay - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-server - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-server-ldap - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9').
